string.value: You think you may have to make a new #t4032312# for #p1201002#, but you don't know where to start, since you don't know what to use or how to make it. Maybe #b#p1201000##k knows a thing or two?

#p1201000# tells you to head over to #m140030000# and use the Mirror of Desire to discover how to make a #t4032312#. That seems to be the only possible solution. Oh well…you should go to #b#m140030000##k.\r\n\r\n#i4032312# #t4032312# #b#c4032312# / 1#k
You successfully made a #t4032312#. Thankfully, #p1201002# seemed quite satisfied with it. Having recovered the powers of the Red Jade, #p1201002# unlocked more abilities for you.
What happened this time? Hmmm, so you need to make the polearm's gem yourself? My goodness, that weapon definitely has an attitude, but you can't ignore its pleas either....
#t4032312# is probably a gem that has the power to exponentially expand the weapon's powers, which means you'll have to cater to its wishes and make it a #t4032312# as it wishes.
What? You don't know how? That's easy! This is directly related to you, you have a specific target, and you even have a specific wish. That means you can use the #bMirror of Desire#k! Go ahead!

You remember where the Mirror of Desire is, right? Head west, out of town, until you reach a dead end near the ice cliff, inside #m140030000#. There, your task is to find out how to make a #b#t4032312##k, and then make it. The #bMaker Skill#k should come in handy for you.
…Eh? What is it? Are there side effects to using the Mirror of Desire? Or do you really not like anything that seems to have to do with the occult? I refuse to put up with whiners!

Still not able to find what the polearm wanted? I'm telling you, the Mirror of Desire will tell you exactly where it is! Don't tell me you forgot how to get to #m140030000#. Just head all the way west past town.
A master who'd forgotten how to make a #b#t4032312##k…?! I can't believe I am owned by this 'hero.' No reason to dream, no reason to hope… *Sigh*
